metadata.description:
I am a Jamaican Reggae Fusion Artist, a peaceful warrior always looking on the bright side. Elevating collective consciousness one idea at a time, serving the SkyStarter community. 

SkyStarters are tenacious, creative, optimistic, compassionate and empathetic. They can also be misfits and misunderstood. The only requirement to be a Skystarter is that We Never Give Up. Within us is an innate power that comes to the aid of the resilient and weaving through the SkyStarter fabric is an unwavering tenacity to Never Give Up 

Wake up created a portal that reminds me to always step into the NOW. Regardless of the past, what matters, NOW, is that I must pick up the hammer and get to work. This song is me coming to terms with the past and even the future. Realizing all I really have is NOW. 

I wrote this song looking for a new path to the same destination. I knew where I wanted to be but I know I wasn't going in the best direction to make it a reality. I became self-aware about the stories in my head and felt the courage and faith to wake up and create a new story

Wake Up is a call to take a hold of life and take our goals seriously. To be present despite the past, despite the future. Be present with all your mind, heart and soul. 

To Wake Up everyday with a picture and a purpose, with intention, with gratitude. Wake Up is an ode to nature. An anthem for more love, for the hungry to be fed. A celebration to embrace who you are and Never Give Up.

Each holder of Wake Up gets a free mint from the upcoming album collection, a private link to the album and access to a token-gated performance of tracks from the album.

lyrics.text:
Seeking in despair 
trying to find a reason to care 
I’m not a seer there’s a feeling in the air 
The oneness between the seen and seer
I'm here, I don’t know for how long
Why? Should I let my dreams pass by? 
When I have means to get it done 
underneath the setting sun 
no other day to get it 
so mi haffi get it now
I know the Lord hears my prayers 
Chanting a psalm while dancing in a seance  
feeling playful with marbles and crayons  
Life is so joyful my heart doesn’t weigh on me 
I wonder, “how long can it last?” 
when u moving 
but haven’t moved on from the past 
I was too caught up to ask
Now everything caught up

Everyday mi wake up 
Mi haffi bun a spliff
Can't find my way home 
Last night was lit yo
Trying to find my way
Trying to find my way
Trying to find my way home

Everyday mi wake up 
Mi haffi give thanks
Naa no time fi waste
You no know how much you have yo
Naa no time fi waste 
Naa no time fi waste no
When we touch up at the stage show

Everyday mi wake up
Haffi visualize how mi day go 
Haffi start the mission right 
What's the way up?
Start to realize 
It's easier to die it's hard to be alive
All the way up yo 
We going all the way up 
All i know it’s all because of prayer 
peaceful and also the cause of chaos
Jus’ a try fi reach home

Everyday mi wake up 
Mi haffi bun a spliff
Can't find my way home 
Last night was lit yo
Trying to find my way
Trying to find my way
Trying to find my way home

Everyday mi wake up 
Mi haffi give thanks
Naa no time fi waste
You no know how much you have yo
Naa no time fi waste 
Naa no time fi waste no
When we touch up at the stage show

Deh ya a bun the hybrid 
Look what i did: can’t open my eyelid
‘Start From The Sky’ style with the Sky kid 
There's nothing a hungry child did 
to deserve to be hungry 
See the world, weh the love deh? 
Its best found in nature
Where instead of cut the grass on a snake hunt
We let the blades of the grass cut the snake up 
Baby girl you’re perfect with an A-cup
If your worth was a weight 
The whole world 
would have to get its weight up 
And I mean waaay up
So glad I never gave up 

Everyday mi wake up 
Mi haffi bun a spliff
Can't find my way home 
Last night was lit yo
Trying to find my way
Trying to find my way
Trying to find my way home

Everyday mi wake up 
Mi haffi give thanks
Naa no time fi waste
You no know how much you have yo
Naa no time fi waste 
Naa no time fi waste no
When we touch up at the stage show

Jamaican Patois (Slang) Meaning

“Haffi” or “Mi haffi” - i have to 
“Naa no” - i don’t have no 
“Jus’ a try fi” - Just trying to 
“Deh ya” - i’m here
“Deh ya a bun” - i’m here burning
“weh the love deh” - where’s the love
“You no know” - You don’t know
